intro: Phyllanthus rozennae, commonly known as the Madagascar starleaf, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique morphology and habitat make it a notable species in botanical studies.
